q: , Colin Powell would make no commitment yet for the 2012 title="White House" href="http://www.dailypress.com/topic/politics/government/executive-branch/white-house-PLCUL000110.topic"> White House race.`` I will always vote for the person who I think is best qualified,'' he said. I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates. I have not yet seen anybody on the Republican side that I am ready to commit to and I am not committed to Barack Obama either.

continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role,'' Andy Coulson said in an e-mailed statement today. Andy Coulson resigned from the newspaper, owned by Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp., after a reporter and a private investigator were imprisoned for phone-tapping in 2007. Auditions for US contestants begin on 27 March in Los Angeles. Other sessions follow in Chicago, Dallas, Miami, Seattle and New York. Talking at a news conference Simon Cowell said: The top contestant will get$ 1 million(? 619,000) a year for five years, separate from the costs involved in recording and promotion.`` It's a massive, massive risk but it's also an incredible incentive. It puts everybody, rightly, under an enormous amount of pressure.`` I believe I can find a star. But he admitted:`` If they don't sell a single record they still get to keep the money. It is pressure, because if the wrong person wins, I'm in trouble.

Steve Ballmer invited Nokia CEO Stephen Elop to join him on stage.`` Microsoft and Nokia together represents a natural partnership. People are getting it,'' he said. The company said it is targeting for a significant volume of Nokia Windows phones to hit the market in 2012 but did not give more specific details. Despite rocker David Archuleta Cook's surge in recent weeks, the judges were uncharacteristically united in proclaiming early fan favorite teen David Archuleta had outperformed his rival. You came out here tonight to win, and what we have witnessed is a knockout, said prickly judge Simon Cowell .
